reviewText: What's not to love?  It's Bond, it's Sean Connery, and the price was amazing.  This completes my Connery Bond collection nicely.  These movies are always fun to watch.
Title: Sean Connery 007 Collection: Volume 2

reviewText: While the newer Bond films have all the proper glitz and glammer,  this second edition is essential for anyone who wants to see where the genre improved its style and techniques.  This is mostly due to the popularity of the first films allowing for increased budgets, making each film a standard by which many films are made today.  I also enjoyed the commentaries, which add a textural and historical aspect to the films.
Title: Sean Connery 007 Collection: Volume 2

reviewText: I purchased this product from Amazon and am quite pleased with it.  It replaces three VHS tapes that were lost in transit when we moved. I am very happy with the DVD.
Title: Sean Connery 007 Collection: Volume 2

reviewText: It is the "Ultimate Collection" if you think Sean Connery is the No.1 Bond of all time.  Very well boxed and formatted to include many extras that would interested even the border line Bond fan.  I bought just Vol 1 and 2 as I am not interested in Moore or Lazanby. Pierce and Daniel Craig did some good work and I already had their movies.
summary: Sean is the true Bond, James Bond
Title: Sean Connery 007 Collection: Volume 2

reviewText: works well and keeps small and large knives stored well in the drawer. we now have two of them to hold all the knives
Title: Sean Connery 007 Collection: Volume 2

reviewText: My collelction of James Bond movies are with Sean Connery only.  Why?  Because I have read all the Ian Flemming books and the early movies come closer to what was written and what likely a Double 007 would be capable of doing.  The later versions are move like Hollywood demonstrating their stunt skills with less plot.  I also think that Connery was the closest to the character described by Fleming in his books.The restoration was excellent and the color superb.  I will enjoy seeing these movies for years to come.
Title: Sean Connery 007 Collection: Volume 2

reviewText: Great collection to wrap up the Sean Connery era.  You can tell by "Diamonds Are Forever" that it is starting to wear on him.
Title: Sean Connery 007 Collection: Volume 2

reviewText: Three Bond ultimate editions in one regular size DVD case -- very space efficient.  And the ultimate editions are generally great, though the quality and amount of extras on the second disk vary dramatically from movie to movie.  As to the films, well, Bond, Connery . . . enough said!
summary: Great way to get 3 Bond films
Title: Sean Connery 007 Collection: Volume 2

reviewText: I just ordered Never Say Never Again to complete my 007 collection.  All of the Bonds were great, but no one can touch Sean Connery.

reviewText: sean connery is the best james bond watched volume one already very impressed with it so far very happy now

reviewText: Love all three episodes! Sean Connery is my favorite James Bond actor and I have liked the rest of the cast also.

reviewText: Another gift in the Christmas stack for hubby. He like Sean the best so I thought this would be a nice marathon viewing collection for him. All discs were perfect and my husband was locked in the man cave for hours on Christmas day. A happy camper.
Title: Sean Connery 007 Collection: Volume 2

reviewText: Volume 2 contains: Thunderball, You Only Live Twice, and Diamonds are Forever. Thunderball is often considered the peak of the series although the fact that half the movie is underwater makes the film sort of disorienting. You Only Live Twice is the 1st full appearnace of Blofeld. It's good but the part where James Bond "becomes Japanese" is bizarre to say the least. After that, Sean Connery took a break from the series and George Lazenby starred in the spectacular (and overlooked) "On Her Majesty's Secret Service". You will have to buy that one separately and you undoubtedly should. George Lazenby was offered a 7 picture but decided instead to commit career suicide and declined the offer. This brought Sean Connery back in "Diamonds are Forever." This is definitely the worst of the Sean Connery Bond films but is still worth watching. The plot is confusing and the 1970s aesthetic of big sideburns, floral patterns, ruffled suits and muscle cars doesn't hold a candle to the mid-60s sophistication and style; it is jarring. This collection is worth picking up but it is inferior to the volume 1. Pick up volume 1 first. If you like what you see, buy this one too. As for the Roger Moore films, only purchase "Live and Let Die," "Spy Who loved Me" and "For Your Eyes Only".
Title: Sean Connery 007 Collection: Volume 2

reviewText: Wal-mart has it for under $15 and that goes for all the other ones as well--in store.They have Sean Connery, volumes 1 & 2, 1 volume for Pierce Brosnan, and one for Daniel Craig...all under $15.

reviewText: I like all the James Bond actors, But some of us know who is the best & true Bond fans should have this setSean Connery 007 Collection: Volume 21 & 2=Get it while its still in print,believe Me by 2013 used copy's will go for $100 and more.
Title: Sean Connery 007 Collection: Volume 2

reviewText: In the 1960s, as a college student, I saw the original movies.  What a DELIGHT to see the astounding restorations done, from the original negatives, by Lowery Digital!!! The true colors, the lack of visible scratches and 'noise'... amazing. The VHS and earlier-DVD renditions I have in my possession are absolutely relegated to the trash-heap (well, to giveaway freebies). And that's not the whole of the story --- each film comes with a 'companion' DVD of extra features and behind-the-scenes information and interviews that bring many extra dimensions of appreciation for the astounding collaboration (and serendipity)  behind great films.
summary: You have older versions? Give them away and Treat Yourself!
Title: Sean Connery 007 Collection: Volume 2

reviewText: I am a big fan of the franchise and this movie collection is a great piece to my overall goal of owning every Bond.
Title: Sean Connery 007 Collection: Volume 2

reviewText: Watching Sean Connery as 007 with rudimentary special effects and real stunt work is refreshing and entertaining. Highly recommended, very affordable grouping of early James Bond movies.
summary: The original 007 is still a lot of fun to watch
Title: Sean Connery 007 Collection: Volume 2

reviewText: Sean Connery, the first, the coolest, the baddest Bond of all time. Retro cool, before there was such a thing!

reviewText: This set represents the best of the James Bond series, includes Goldfinger, one of my all time favorites, despite the allusions such as Pussy Galore, a sexist aside by the writer. Arrived on time. Separate shipping denied me free ship savings.
Title: Sean Connery 007 Collection: Volume 2

reviewText: I bought the 6 disk version of the Sean Connery 007 Collection Volume 1 about a year ago.  It is great.  3 great quality movies and 3 bonus disks.  Ultimate Edition Contents.  I wanted to get Volume 2 but they ran out and the prices started to skyrocket.This month the collection is back- MAYBE.  It LOOKS ALMOST the same, but has three disks not six.  It SAYS Ultimate Edition on the outside but makes no mention of Special Features.  Is this a JUST the 3 movies or are the disks double sided so all the special features are included?  If the Special Features are not in there this borders on deceptive advertising.The 2011 has Sean's full face.  The 2012 1/2 his face- for 1/2 the disks perhaps?  Unless you have a real good memory this is not obvious unless the 2 versions are side by side.I have searched the web, I tried to call the Fox customer service number (It was busy) and have sent an email.At this point, the point I am making is that shouldn't it be made clear what is in this package?  Maybe I am being stupid about this but I have tried my best to get some info, but there does not seem to be any.I suppose this is not really a review but cry for help.  Anyone know what's in the box?**UPDATE A FEW DAYS LATER ***I got an email from Fox:Dear Valued Customer,Thank you for your email and interest in Fox products! The Sean Connery Volumes only include the feature films. Should you have any additional questions, please do not hesitate to contact us.Thank you,Customer CareI will probably not purchase the 2012 Collection.  A pity, since the 2011 Collection was so nice.  I am afraid I must reduce my rating to one star for what appears to be deliberately vague, and possibly deceptive packaging.Sincere thanks to Kevin Mahan for sharing his experience with this product.
summary: 6 disks vs 3 disks: What's on it?
Title: Sean Connery 007 Collection: Volume 2

reviewText: Only has the 3 movies and no extras yet it calls this the Ultimate Edition (unless it has double sided discs, which is doesn't). No extras listed on case. Says 3 Disc Set on the case spine.  Set: C 2012 Metro-Goldwyn-Meyer Studios, IncMovies are: Thunderball c 1965/ Colour/ 125 min./PG;  You Only Live Twice c 1967/ Colour/ 117 min./PG; Diamonds Are Forever c 1971/ Colour/ 120 mins./ PG. Pkg. design c 2012 Metro-Goldwyn-Meyer Studios Inc., Distr by Twentieth Century Fox Home Ent LLC. Dolby Digital, DTS Digital Surround, Special features contain unrated material and may not be closed captioned. All of the trademarks and logos are c Danjaq LLC.  This is from the case.There is a 6 disc set of these movies somewhere that has extras.  I don't understand why this cost me $2.00 more than volume 1 which has 6 discs and is only called Sean Connery 007 Collection Vol 1 but IS an Ultimate collection. I think the studio got lazy.I have not watched these movies but other of 2012 release 007 movies are remastered and gorgeous even though not Blu-ray.
summary: This should NOT be called the Ultimate Edition - only 3 discs with 3 movies and no extras.
Title: Sean Connery 007 Collection: Volume 2
